page.title: 17RELIGIOUS PRACTICE TODAY
page.content: There is little religious practice in the 4 churches of the area. Only St Margaret's has a moderately_sized congregation and more than one weekly service. Electoral Rolls and Communicant Figures reveal less than 20 regular worshippers at E.Langdon and Guston. At West Cliffe the services are fortnightly. There are only 2 priests serving the 4 parishes since St Margarte's,E.Langdon and West Cliffe are combined while Guston is united with Whitfield. A large proportion of practicing Christains practice their faith in Dover,Deal and Canterbury. Religion has become eclectic and the parish church has become the preserve of those unable or unwilling to travel. There is a Non_Conformist chapel at St Margraet's which has also suffered declining attendance.
